title: Men's Bracketology: Don't sleep on this year's bubble

title: Source: Padres, Castellanos agree on 1-year deal
content: Free agent outfielder Nick Castellanos has agreed to a one-year deal with the Padres two days after his release by the Phillies, a source confirmed to ESPN.

title: 'I blew it': Malinin falls twice in Olympic shocker
content: American sensation "Quad God" Ilia Malinin fell twice in a disastrous free skate, allowing Kazakhstan's Mikhail Shaidorov to claim a stunning gold medal.

title: Wroblewski calls out officiating after chippy U.S. win
content: Abbey Murphy was once again in the middle of the action, drawing and taking penalties as the U.S. women's hockey team cruised to a 6-0 win over Italy that got "a little spicy" and led to coach John Wroblewski sounding off on Olympic officiating.

title: Pinheiro Braathen wins GS gold in first for Brazil
content: Brazilian ski racer Lucas Pinheiro Braathen turned in a powerful final run to win the Olympic giant slalom and earn South America's first medal at a Winter Games.

title: JJ aims to make final Daytona 500 start in 2027
content: Seven-time NASCAR Cup champion Jimmie Johnson says he will enter one additional Daytona 500 in 2027 before calling it a career.

title: Baylor 1B's 3-grand slam game ties NCAA record
content: Tyce Armstrong made history in his Baylor debut by hitting three grand slams in a 15-2 win over New Mexico State. He became only the second college player to pull off that feat.

title: WR Kingston no longer at BYU after rape charge
content: Brigham Young says standout wide receiver Parker Kingston is no longer a student there after he was arrested this week on a first-degree felony rape charge.

title: Tensions flare over curling cheating allegations
content: The often-sedate world of curling has gotten heated at the Winter Olympics as cheating allegations and audible curse words overshadowed a feisty match between two of the best men's teams.

content: Formula 1's new era was always going to bring questions, but its first week of serious running has raised more than most. With one more preseason test in Bahrain still to come, ESPN makes sense of a fascinating three days in Sakhir.

content: It accuses Vellappally of preparing a fraudulent voters‚Äô list for the upcoming organisational election

title: 701 of 1,278 accident black spots on NH in Karnataka rectified
content: With 1,278 black spots, Karnataka ranks sixth among States with the highest number of accident-prone locations on National Highways in the country.

title: Collector leads 40-km cycle rally to review Thrissur‚ÄìKunnamkulam road works
content: Rally covers the stretch from Ayyanthole Civil Station to Choondal and back. Initiative organised to evaluate the pace and quality of the road development works

title: Jaishankar denies India has lost ‚Äòstrategic autonomy‚Äô
content: An ‚Äúagenda- based coming together of countries on a regular basis‚Äù¬†was ‚Äúvery much the hallmark of Indian diplomacy‚Äù for about two decades, the External Affairs Minister said at the Munich Security Conference

content: The mega convention of ‚ÄòBhoo Guarantee‚Äô at Haveri coincided with the Congress  government¬†completing 1,000 days in office

title: Operation Stripes: Adult male tiger released in Papikonda National Park
content: Named ‚ÄòExplorer‚Äô, the big cat has been fitted with a satellite collar and transmission of data regarding its movements has commenced; special teams have been deployed to monitor its movements in the wild until it establishes its own territory

content: Finance Minister speaks after inaugurating a development seminar for Kollam‚Äôs Neduvathur grama panchayat‚Äôs 2026-27 People‚Äôs Plan campaign

content: This comes on the day that SIR hearings were formally completed in the State after a¬†seven-day¬†extension

content: The 2026-27 outlay focuses on AI-enabled policing, Cybercrime Police Stations in all districts, 3,000 new vehicles, 100 new courts and modernisation of Fire Services

title: Yuva Morcha leader ‚Äòthreatens‚Äô Keralotsavam judges
content: The man, who runs a Kalaripayattu training centre, was allegedly unhappy with the marks awarded to his wards in the competition

title: Kerala Veterinary and Animal Sciences University scientists win patent for breakthrough ‚Äòstarter culture‚Äô technology
content: Innovative starter concentrate developed through respiratory mode allows extended shelf life, promising major boost to dairy processing sector

title: Congress disappointed over its failure to restrict BRS: KTR
content: Working president of Opposition party says the Congress fared worse when in Opposition, compared to BRS now

title: 'Eat well and go to sleep': Surya, Agha sidestep handshake chatter pre India-Pakistan WC clash
content: Captains Suryakumar Yadav and Salman Ali Agha remained non-committal on whether India and Pakistan players would shake hands before or after their T20 World Cup clash. Both leaders suggested waiting until match day for a decision, emphasizing their focus on playing good cricket. This follows a history where India did not shake hands with Pakistan in previous encounters.

title: PM Modi invitation likely? BNP leader cites 'friends to all' ahead of Rahman's swearing-in
content: Bangladesh Nationalist Party leader ANM Ehsanul Hoque Milan suggested inviting Indian Prime Minister Narendra Modi to the swearing-in ceremony of BNP chief Tarique Rahman, who is set to become the next Prime Minister. The BNP secured a landslide victory in the general elections, marking their return to power after nearly two decades.

title: Do jism, ek jaan? No thanks: How Gamophobia is changing the language of love
content: Gamophobia, the fear of commitment or marriage, is a growing concern, extending beyond simple jitters to a deep-seated emotional resistance. This phenomenon, fueled by increased choice, individualism, and witnessing relationship breakdowns, is prompting individuals to question traditional marital structures and redefine what love and commitment entail in the modern world.

title: 'Victory is not declared by mere rhetoric': CDS Gen Anil Chauhan takes swipe at Pakistan
content: Chief of Defence Staff General Anil Chauhan emphasized that "actual vijay lies in demonstrated evidence," referencing India's counterterror actions. He stressed that victory isn't built on rhetoric but on tangible outcomes like damaged terror infrastructure and dysfunctional air defence systems, urging a sober assessment of India's defense preparedness for future challenges.

title: Analyst bets Google will beat Nvidia to become world's most-valuable company in 2026
content: An analyst suggests Google could surpass Nvidia in market capitalization by 2026, driven by its broad AI platform and in-house chips. Google's strong performance in search and cloud, coupled with its proprietary hardware, positions it to benefit from the rising costs and constraints of AI computing infrastructure, offering a compelling alternative to expensive, power-hungry processors.

title: Russia killed opposition leader Navalny using dart frog toxin, 5 European nations say
content: Five European nations confirmed Alexei Navalny was poisoned with a lethal toxin, accusing the Russian state. Laboratory analysis detected epibatidine, a powerful poison not naturally found in Russia. The countries will report Moscow to the Organisation for the Prohibition of Chemical Weapons for an alleged breach of the Chemical Weapons Convention.

title: Happy Maha Shivratri 2026: Top 50 wishes, messages, and quotes
content: Maha Shivratri offers a unique, quiet devotion, symbolizing faith, strength, and surrender. Millions observe this night of prayer and reflection, with many fasting and offering prayers to Lord Shiva. The festival provides a much-needed pause in busy lives, reminding devotees of inner peace and the enduring power of faith, offering comfort and hope.

title: Not India vs Pakistan anymore, it's all about Usman Tariq‚Äôs bowling action in Colombo
content: Ahead of the India-Pakistan blockbuster, the spotlight has shifted from rivalry to scrutiny, with Usman Tariq‚Äôs bowling action dominating discourse and unsettling both batters and press rooms in Colombo.

title: After CEO asked employees to stop coding, Nvidia engineers get access to OpenAI's Codex
content: Nvidia has deployed OpenAI's Codex AI coding tool to all 30,000 engineers, marking a significant enterprise rollout. CEO Jensen Huang's mandate to automate tasks with AI is driving this adoption, with engineers praising the tool's ability to handle complex workflows and maintain context.

title: BNP‚Äôs landslide brings anti-India leaders to mainstream; casts shadow on Dhaka-Delhi ties
content: Bangladesh's elections bring the BNP to power with a decisive mandate, but the return of controversial leaders with past convictions and alleged anti-India links complicates regional ties. The new government's push for former PM Sheikh Hasina's extradition from India presents an immediate diplomatic challenge, signaling a potential shift in bilateral relations.

title: Cisco president Jeetu Patel says company will never hire these developers
content: Cisco's president Jeetu Patel mandates AI for all developers, aiming for half a dozen AI-coded products by 2026. This shift to spec-driven development sees human teams shrink, with AI agents tripling output. While embracing AI's potential, Cisco is investing heavily in security to prevent rogue agents, urging developers to master AI to stay relevant.

title: From prison cell to power play: The Lawrence Bishnoi gang network targeting celebrities
content: Jailed gangster Lawrence Bishnoi's alleged network continues to target high-profile figures, with recent threats and incidents involving Salman Khan, Ranveer Singh, and Rohit Shetty. Investigations reveal a pattern of intimidation, including ransom demands and firing incidents, extending to Canada. The Bishnoi gang's alleged involvement in the Sidhu Moosewala murder and the Baba Siddique shooting highlights their extensive reach.

title: Horrific Valentine‚Äôs Day murder in Noida: Man shoots woman inside car, then turns gun on himself
content: A man and a woman were discovered dead from gunshot wounds inside a locked car in Noida's Sector 107. Police found a pistol in the man's hand, suggesting a possible murder-suicide. The deceased have been identified, and their families have been notified. Investigations are ongoing to determine the exact sequence of events.

title: India‚Äôs climate spending rises to 5.6% of GDP, Sitharaman says at Munich
content: India has significantly boosted climate action spending, now at nearly 5.6% of GDP, up from 3.7% six years ago, demonstrating strong domestic commitment. Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman emphasized the need for adaptation alongside emission cuts and advocated for a "polluter pays" principle in global climate finance, highlighting India's own substantial investments in renewables and carbon capture.

title: Team Canada rules out Brad Marchand, Josh Morrissey vs Switzerland
content: Team Canada faces Switzerland at the 2026 Winter Olympics without key players Josh Morrissey and Brad Marchand. Morrissey is sidelined with an undisclosed injury sustained against Czechia, while Marchand's absence remains unexplained. Seth Jarvis is set to make his Olympic debut, replacing Morrissey on the third line, with Travis Sanheim also stepping into the lineup.

title: Kylie Young grabs attention at WM Phoenix Open in summer frock
content: Jack Bech‚Äôs girlfriend Kylie Young used the WM Phoenix Open to quietly own the offseason, sharing sundress and golf-day looks that stood out while the Las Vegas Raiders regroup from a 3-14 year. From Phoenix to Aspen and Raiders game days, her Instagram keeps building a separate highlight reel around the rookie wide receiver.

title: Candace Owens calls claims about Erika Kirk 'absolutely vile'
content: A viral post has intensified debate over Candace Owens‚Äô use of the term grooming in reference to a 15 year old. Critic Natly Denise accused Owens of exaggerating the situation, while Owens cited details from her own interview describing limited in person contact and online messages. The clash highlights ongoing tensions over how serious terms are defined and used in public commentary.

title: 'Yellow sari, sindoor, mangalsutra': In new video, ‚ÄòNaagin‚Äô woman resurfaces with lover
content: A young woman, Reena, who vanished from her home in Auraiya, leaving behind a snake slough and sparking 'naagin' rumors, has reappeared claiming a willing marriage. In videos, she asserts her choice to be with her lover, urging an end to the pursuit. Police are investigating her elopement, which followed a period of alleged fascination with snakes.

title: 'If Pakistan captain wants, we'll play him': SKY after Agha's comment on Abhishek
content: Pakistan captain Salman Ali Agha hopes India's Abhishek Sharma recovers for their World Cup clash, stating they wish to compete against a full-strength Indian side.  India's Suryakumar Yadav responded humorously to the sentiment. Sharma, a top-ranked T20I batter, has a strong record against Pakistan, making his potential return significant for the highly anticipated match.

title: Operation Hawkeye: US forces conduct strikes on over 30 IS targets in Syria
content: US forces have intensified pressure on ISIS in Syria with 10 strikes hitting over 30 targets, including infrastructure and weapons depots, between February 3-12. This follows earlier strikes and is part of Operation Hawkeye, a retaliatory response to a deadly December ambush. Over 50 terrorists have been neutralized, with hundreds of precision munitions deployed to degrade ISIS capabilities.

title: Fans link Offset‚Äôs Valentine flex to Cardi B‚ÄìDiggs split
content: Cardi B‚Äôs fans are dragging her from lavish rose-petal Valentines with Offset to a teary breakup tour and Stefon Diggs‚Äô growing legal chaos, breaking down the viral tweet, old Super Bowl tension, messy Instagram comments, new court dates, and why so many now think she is spending Valentine‚Äôs Day heartbreakingly alone with a newborn son in her arms this year.

title: Nagarjuna on rejecting Rehman Dakait role in Dhurandhar, praises Akshaye Khanna
content: Ever since Aditya Dhar‚Äôs Dhurandhar hit theatres, the film has been the talk of the town. While Akshaye Khanna turned into an overnight internet sensation with his menacing act as Rehman Dakait, recent rumours claimed that the role was initially offered to Nagarjuna ‚Äî and that the South superstar had turned it down.

title: 'Politics of negativity': Piyush Goyal rejects Rahul's concerns over India-US trade deal
content: Union minister Piyush Goyal attacked Rahul Gandhi over the India-US trade deal, accusing him of "foolishness" and "sabotaging India's growth." Goyal countered Gandhi's claims about hurting farmers and exporters, highlighting the potential for textile market growth and job creation. He also pointed out that Gandhi's party initiated policies allowing duty-free import of raw materials for exports.

title: Pakistan captain adds fuel to handshake controversy - 'We‚Äôll find that out'
content: Pakistan captain Salman Ali Agha reignited the handshake controversy ahead of the India clash, saying he hopes for sportsmanship but adding, ‚ÄúWe‚Äôll find that out tomorrow.‚Äù India arrived in Colombo to a festive welcome and will train separately from Pakistan. Key Indian players are set to feature, with spin expected to play a big role. Agha had earlier criticised India‚Äôs past handshake refusal, calling it bad for the game and young fans.

title: Hardik Pandya inks heartfelt Valentine's Day 'M' tattoo for girlfriend Mahieka ‚Äì Watch
content: Cricketer Hardik Pandya celebrated his love for girlfriend Mahieka Sharma with a unique tattoo featuring two leopards, symbolizing their strength and partnership.  This meaningful ink, conceptualized with artists, marks a special Valentine's surprise.  Pandya also showcased his prowess on the field, delivering a stellar performance against Namibia with both bat and ball, earning him Player of the Match.

title: Pitch report from Colombo: India vs Pakistan to be played on used surface
content: The highly anticipated India vs Pakistan clash on February 15 will be played on a used surface at the R Premadasa Stadium in Colombo, a factor that could significantly influence conditions and strategy in the marquee T20 World Cup encounter.

title: Sunny Deol hints at a title change of his upcoming movie 'Lahore 1947'
content: Fans of Sunny Deol are eagerly anticipating his next project, 'Lahore 1947', which is helmed by the talented Rajkumar Santoshi and produced by the legendary Aamir Khan. However, there's buzz in the air about a possible title change! This cinematic experience, inspired by a renowned play, is set to hit theaters in August. Read on to know more in detail

title: Under-construction metro pillar collapses in Mumbai's Mulund West; 1 dead
content: A section of an under-construction metro rail pillar collapsed onto an autorickshaw in Mulund West on Saturday afternoon, with three to four individuals feared injured. The incident occurred near the Johnson & Johnson company on LBS Road when a cement segment gave way during ongoing work. Rescue operations are underway, and the injured are being transported to a hospital.

title: 'Cleared by the ICC': Pakistan captain Agha backs 'trump card' Usman Tariq
content: Pakistan captain Salman Ali Agha confirmed spinner Usman Tariq has been cleared by the ICC, dismissing concerns over his bowling action ahead of the India clash. Agha emphasized Tariq's importance as a "trump card" and stated the player remains unaffected by the debate.

title: 'Power-sharing is essential': Cong presses DMK again after Stalin's red line in Tamil Nadu
content: Congress seeks more seats from DMK for the Tamil Nadu assembly elections. MP Manickam Tagore stated power sharing is essential for governance. DMK leader RS Raja Kannappan earlier claimed DMK would contest 170 seats. Formal alliance talks are set to begin on February 22. The INDIA bloc remains united despite BJP's efforts.

title: 'Don't know if they're serious': Rubio on Russia's intent to end Ukraine war
content: US secretary of state Marco Rubio expressed doubts about Russia's commitment to ending the Ukraine war, even as new peace talks loom.  Speaking at the Munich Security Conference, Rubio emphasized the need for "seriousness and reciprocity" from allies, while also reassuring Europe of strong transatlantic ties and a desire for a "reinvigorated alliance."

title: Man 'Dies' In Meghalaya Mine Explosion, Returns Home After His Last Rites
content: A mine worker who was among the 31 declared dead in the devastating explosion in an illegal rat-hole coal mine in East Jaintia Hills in Meghalaya has returned home alive, days after his last rites were performed.

title: Madras High Court Orders Probe Into Bribe Allegations In Gold Fraud Case
content: The Madras High Court has ordered a vigilance inquiry into allegations that a senior lawyer received Rs 50 lakh from accused persons, allegedly to be paid to a judge for securing favourable orders in a gold trade fraud case.

title: Chaos To Coaching: How AI Is Helping Slash Road Fatalities In India
content: As India prepares for the upcoming AI Impact Summit, a quiet revolution is unfolding across its 64-lakh-kilometre road network.

title: 6-Year-Old Dies 15 Days After Sister's Death, Mother Gave Them Rat Poison
content: Police in Punjab's Bathinda have arrested a woman for allegedly poisoning her two minor children. The suspect, believed to be involved in an extramarital affair, reportedly fed the children food laced with rat poison.

title: US Military Used Claude AI In Venezuela Operation To Capture Maduro: Report
content: The US military used artificial intelligence in its operation to capture Venezuelan President Nicolas Maduro last month, according to a report by the Wall Street Journal.

title: Delhi Police Busts Fake Medicine Factory In Bihar, 9 Arrested
content: The Delhi Police have busted a fake medicine manufacturing unit in Bihar's Gaya, the second in the last week, and arrested one more accused linked to an interstate drug syndicate, an official said on Friday.

title: IIT Kanpur Technician Hangs Self After Argument With Fiance
content: A 28-year-old junior technician at the Indian Institute of Technology-Kanpur (IIT-K) on Saturday hanged herself to death inside the campus accommodation allegedly after disconnecting her phone with fiance.

title: Parliament Data Reveals Madhya Pradesh, Chhattisgarh Lag In Drone Adoption
content: A written reply tabled in the Lok Sabha has brought fresh scrutiny to the pace of drone adoption in Madhya Pradesh and Chhattisgarh, even as the Centre claims to have significantly liberalised India's drone ecosystem.

title: 76-Year-Old Man Dies, 9 Injured In Bee Attack In Odisha
content: A 76-year-old man died and at least nine others were injured when a swarm of bees attacked them in Odisha's Kendrapara district, police said on Saturday.

title: 7 Years Of Pulwama: How India Cracked Case, Changed Anti-Terror Response
content: Seven years after Pulwama, Jaish-e-Mohammad chief Masood Azhar remains elusive, his freedom of movement curtailed. India's assertive retaliation strategy has forced him into hiding, stripping Pakistan of its erstwhile safe haven status.

title: 4 Killed As Car Plunges In Gorge In Himachal Pradesh: Cops
content: Four people, including a woman and her son, were killed and another sustained serious injuries when their car plunged into a deep gorge in Kinnaur, police said on Saturday.

title: CEO Jensen Huang Won't Attend India AI Impact Summit: Nvidia
content: Nvidia CEO Jensen Huang will not be travelling to India next week for the India AI Impact Summit, which global technology industry and political leaders are likely to attend, the company said on Saturday.

title: India Set To Resume Work On Wular Barrage, Stalled By Indus Waters Treaty
content: Nine months after suspending the Indus Waters Treaty (IWT) following the Pahalgam attack, the Jammu and Kashmir government is set to resume work on the stalled Wular barrage. The project aims to regulate water storage from the Jhelum River.

title: How 'Project Empathy' Helps Preserve Nagaland's Oral History Collections
content: A project themed on empathy is bringing a positive change, without any fanfare, in Nagaland after it guided college students to return to their communities and engage in intimate conversations with elders.

title: 1 Killed, 3 Injured After Portion Of Mumbai Metro Pillar Falls On Vehicles
content: A portion of a pillar of the Mumbai Metro peeled off and fell on a road below in Mulund (West) today, killing one and leaving three others critically injured, officials said.

title: 'BJP' Makes Its Mark In Bangladesh Elections, Wins 1 Seat
content: In Bangladesh's 13th General Elections, the Bangladesh Jatiya Party (BJP) secured a single seat, with Andaleeve Rahman Partho winning from the Bhola-1 constituency.

title: 'Want Ties With India Based On Mutual Respect': Tarique Rahman's Top Aide To NDTV
content: The new Bangladesh government led by Tarique Rahman's BNP wants to build people-to-people ties with neighbouring India and strengthen bilateral relationship through trade and investments, a top aide of Rahman told NDTV.

title: Video: PM Modi Lands Aboard C-130J Aircraft On Assam Highway
content: Prime Minister Narendra Modi made a historic landing at northeast's first emergency landing facility aboard C-130J aircraft in Assam's Moran, beginning his one-day tour of the state that is slated to go to polls soon.

title: "You Captured My Heart": Valentine's Day Message For Maduro From White House
content: The White House has released a series of politically charged digital cards for Valentine's Day on social media.

title: Tarique Rahman's Pakistan Test: Dhaka's Gameplan After Yunus Reset
content: With Tarique Rahman set to take over as the next Prime Minister of Bangladesh, all eyes would be on how he deals with Pakistan.

title: Elaborate arrangements in place for Sivaratri celebrations
content: Police and Fire and Rescue Services will conduct intense patrol. A special police team will be deployed to control rush at the Aluva railway station

title: Bengaluru-based research institute¬†working on AI tool to improve spacecraft hygiene
content: The project by Prayoga aims to develop an AI-assisted instrument for the assessment of antibacterial efficacy of materials used in space applications

title: School Education gets highest allocations of ‚Çπ32,308 crore in A.P. Budget
content: ‚Çπ1,500 crore allocated for upgrading infra in public schools, ‚Çπ2,567 crore for higher education, ‚Çπ1,232 crore for Skill Development and Training Department

title: Status of Minister to legislators, party workers to burden Karnataka exchequer
content: The total number of individuals enjoying Cabinet or ministerial-level privileges now exceeds the total strength of Congress MLAs in the Assembly

title: Indus basin water flows rose while Ganga declined since 1980, study shows
content: Annual streamflow in the Indus Basin rose 8% since 1980, but fell 17% in the Ganga Basin; more rain boosted flow in the Indus, Jhelum, Chenab, but not in the Ravi and Sutlej, with implications for the suspended Indus Waters Treaty

title: Agriculture Budget failed to address farmers‚Äô distress: YSRCP
content: The party general secretary alleges that ‚Çπ240 crore for seed subsidy and ‚Çπ139.65 crore for mechanisation are inadequate, and says farmers suffered losses due to prices falling below MSP; terms ‚Çπ500 crore for price stabilisation through Markfed insufficient

title: Fire at coconut fibre unit near Gudiyatham
content: Police said it was around 11.30 a.m on Saturday when a few residents in the village saw smoke in the unit

title: Veterinary centre for vaccination, sterilization of community dogs in Vellore Corporation inaugurated
content: Spread over 8,000 sq.ft, the new centre will function round-the-clock on all days including Sundays with at least two doctors and four attendants

title: Former Finance Minister Buggana calls A.P. Budget a bundle of lies
content: The format of the Budget document was altered to avoid presenting the mandatory ten-year comparative data, masking the State‚Äôs fiscal performance, says Buggana

title: Premkumar alleges ‚Äòdouble standards‚Äô in his removal from Chalachitra academy chairperson post
content: He asks why Sahitya Akademi president Satchidanandan is allowed to continue in the post despite his comments on the perils of prolonged rule, while he was ousted for supporting ASHA workers‚Äô protest. Minister Saji Cherian says just routine procedure was followed in Premkumar‚Äôs case

title: Cardamom growers alarmed by drought-like weather pattern in Idukki
content: Farmers say daytime temperatures in plantations touched 29¬∞C by the second week of February ‚Äî unusually high for this time of the year

title: Increasing reliance on off-budget borrowings casts a shadow
content: The ‚ÄòStatement of Government Guarantees‚Äô, presented as part of the 2026-27 Budget, reveals that the total guaranteed amount availed as of December 31, 2025, touched ‚Çπ3,11,182.28 crore

title: Nvidia CEO Jensen Huang won't attend AI Impact Summit in India, company says
content: He would ‚Å†not be travelling due to ‚Äúunforseen circumstances,‚Äù the ‚Äåcompany‚Äôs media agency in ‚ÄãIndia, MSL, said

title: Recipients of 10-month-old Aalin‚Äôs liver and kidneys doing well
content: Kerala‚Äôs youngest organ donor Aalin Sherin Abraham‚Äôs liver and kidneys have been transplanted in a six-month-old and 10-year-old child respectively. Aalin‚Äôs funeral will take place on Sunday with State honours

title: CPI terms Budget a self-congratulatory exercise
content: Party State secretary alleges failure to implement Super Six promises, flags lack of clarity on jobs, women assistance and irrigation funding

title: Arunachal Governor points out China‚Äôs long-term strategy along frontiers
content: During a seminar in Assam‚Äôs Tinsukia, Governor Lieutenant General (retd.) K.T. Parnaik describes the border State as a strategic buffer as well as a land of immense human, cultural and economic potential

title: Two Bengal academicians win A.K. Ramanujan Prize for translating Dalit woman poet‚Äôs works
content: The translated volume, I Belong to Nowhere, brings works of Dalit poet Kalyani Thakur Charal to global readers.

title: Health outlay rises 9.5% to ‚Çπ19,306 crore in Budget: Satya Kumar Yadav
content: Health Minister says the sector ranks fourth in allocations, with major funding for medical education, Dr. NTR Vaidya Seva Trust and Ayushman Bharat to strengthen public health systems

title: Three-day International Conference on Development and Democracy to open on Sunday in Thiruvananthapuram
content: Renowned economists, policy and planning experts and scholars from across the globe will participate in the event which aims to evolve a development perspective for Kerala for the period up to 2031

title: Andhra Pradesh on the path to recovery and growth, says Chief Minister Chandrababu Naidu
content: The government has presented the best possible budget under the prevailing circumstances, he says, adding that finances are being managed with the support of the Union government

title: Protest over inclusion of non-medical degrees for faculty appointment in medical colleges
content: The Kerala PSC had included non-medical Biochemistry postgraduates in the written examination and selection process for appointment towards the posts of Assistant Professor in Biochemistry in government medical colleges in the State

title: Budget balances welfare, growth and fiscal discipline: BJP
content: Party spokesperson says reduction in revenue and fiscal deficits despite higher expenditure reflects prudent financial management

title: Cabinet resolution hails shifting of PMO to Seva Teerth as 'confluence of history and future'

title: 4 family members die after consuming methanol ‚Äòmistaken for liquor‚Äô
content: the victims had been working on contract as dishwashers at a wedding ceremony for the past three days . they brought the chemical from the wedding venue to their home and drank it, after which their condition deteriorated and they died . the victims were identified as Ratan Kanjar (49), Sushila Devi (48), Jamni Devi (62) and Badami Devi Kanjar, 60 .

title: Weekend preview: Ronaldo's return; Inter-Juve in to decide title?
content: the "Futbol Americas" crew discuss weston McKennie's recent form for the club . this week, we take you to England , Scotland , Spain , Italy , France and even Saudi Arabia for a big derby, some Cup magic and new managers galore . the team are currently fourth in the premier league, with a record 4th manager of season .

title: Olympics men's hockey daily: U.S back in action against Denmark
content: Saturday is the fourth day of the men's ice hockey tournament at the 2026 Olympics in Milan Cortina . on Wednesday, Slovakia stunned the hockey world by defeating Finland 4-1 in the first game of the tournament . Saturday marks the return to action for the U.S., which takes on Denmark, as well as Germany-Latvia, Sweden-Slovakia and Finland-Italie .

title: A supersized Big Mac attack: Grades, takeaways from Canada's 5-1 win over Switzerland
content: a combined final score of 10-1 for the 2026 olympic men's hockey tournament . a pair of famous linemates also hit the scoresheet in this one . the top player of the game, lessons learned, a big question for their final group play game against France .

title: NBA All-Star 2026: Team Vince defeats Team Melo to win Rising Stars championship game
content: this year marks the 75th annual NBA All-Star Game . two teams of U.S. players will face one world team in a round-robin tournament with four 12-minute games . the loser of Game 1 will face Team C in the penultimate game .

title: Kyle Tucker's Dodgers contract: Final blow for labor peace?
content: a group of fans are angry at baseball . they are inside of group chats that talk about how much money the Los Angeles Dodgers are spending . owners blame the system that governs Major League Baseball . a salary cap would juiper the game, owners say .

title: 11 draft prospects with a true first-round grade
content: the average draft class has roughly 15 players who are deemed "first-round talents" a player would have been a first-rounder in each of the past five classes . the 2026 class actually has fewer players at the moment .

title: WNBA mock draft: Who follows Azzi Fudd at No. 1?
content: the WNBA and players' association continue negotiating a new collective bargaining agreement . most players not under rookie contracts are free agents, plus there are two expansion teams that don't have any players yet . we are projecting draft selections without important context about the players they will be joining .

title: Season preview: Top storylines, POY picks and MCWS predictions
content: our college baseball experts break it all down, plus give some way-too-early predictions for the end of the year . we've got a slew of new head coaches at top programs looking to make their marks early on, like Josh Elander at Tennessee and Chris Pollard at Virginia .

title: Way-Too-Early All-America team: Forecasting college football's top players in 2026
content: the Longhorns finished 10-3 last season and missed the college football Playoff . the 2026 Way-Too-Early All-America team is a tough position to pick just one player . quarterback arch Manning, receiver Cam Coleman and linebackers Colin Simmons and Rasheem Biles are on the team .
